Branching Using Multiple Locks

To create a branch using multiple locking, you must check in a revision with a secondary lock. This means that multiple Users have checked out the same revision with a lock. The first User who locks the revision reserves the primary lock on the revision. The other Users who have the revision locked must check in their revisions as branches.

You can only lock a revision more than once if your project or project database is configured to allow multiple locks per revision. See Setting Up Multiple Locks for Branching and the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager Administrator's Guide for information on setting up projects and project databases to use multiple locks.
